c74object.name: dada.life.info

outlet.description: Outputs the pattern period, or "inf" if no periodicity is detected (until maxiter).

If a periodicity is detected, outputs the displacement of the pattern after one full period, in the form delta_x delta_y. If no periodicity is detected, null is output. For instance, the standard life glider will have as displacement 1 -1, since it will appear again after one period 1 cell at right and 1 cell down with respect to the original pattern.
Outputs the number of step before pattern becomes an empty matrix (every cell dies); "inf" if no annihilation is detected (until maxiter).
Outputs the pattern matrix, where all the empty rows and columns at left, right, top and bottom are removed; in other words the pattern is output in its "minimal matrix".
Outputs the coordinates of the "minimal matrix" with respect to the full world matrix, in the form start_row end_row start_col end_col.
If the orbit attribute is non-zero, outputs the sequence of patterns that follows the incoming one, each wrapped in a level of parenthesis.

If the orbit attribute is non-zero, outputs the trimmed pattern orbit, i.e. the pattern orbit (see previous outlet), but trimmed in its "minimal matrix", i.e. all the empty rows at left, right, top and bottom are removed.

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the information on the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the first inlet is considered as a dada.life dump (i.e. the llll one obtains when sending a dump message to dada.life. Information about patterns, periodicity and translation is reported from all outlets (see the documentation for each one of the outlets).

attribute.name: border
attribute.description: Sets the border conditions, establishing how the cells just beyond the world limits should be considered

attribute.name: born
attribute.description: Lists all the possibilities for the number of neighbours a dead cell must have in order to be born

attribute.name: customrule
attribute.description: Toggles the usage of the possibly defined custom rule for the automaton. The custom rule must be written in C and sent via the rule message.

attribute.name: lattice
attribute.description: Sets the lattice type (either 0 = square, which is the default, or 1 = triangular)

attribute.name: maxiter
attribute.description: Set the maximum number of iteration for the analysis algorithm. (If an oscillator or spaceship is detected, the pattern is stopped before maxiter is reached.)

attribute.name: neighborhood
attribute.description: Sets the neighborhood size (for the born and stayalive attributes, as well as for the custom rule).

attribute.name: orbit
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to also output the pattern orbit (defaults to 1).

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: stayalive
attribute.description: Lists all the possibilities for the number a living cell must have in order to stay alive

c74object.discussion: This module is an abstraction, the algorithms it implements are the naive algorithms. Hence it will not be the most efficient implementation, nor the most powerful one.
